detailed_info.name: Cetearyl alcohol
detailed_info.description:
Cetearyl alcohol belongs to the family of fatty alcohols. It is used as emollient. It helps to thicken the creams and stabilize them. It softens and protects the skin without oily effect. Cetearyl alcohol contains mainly cetyl alcohol (Cetyl alcohol) and stearyl alcohol (Stearyl alcohol). It is authorized in organic.

The CIR (Cosmetic Ingredient Review) in an annual report published in 2008, concluded the safety of fatty alcohols.
detailed_info.reference: CIR Annual Review of Cosmetic Ingredient Safety Assessments: 2005/2006 - (2008) https://online.personalcarecouncil.org/ctfa-static/online/lists/cir-pdfs/prn547.PDF

detailed_info.name: Cetyl alcohol
detailed_info.description:
Cetyl alcohol is a fatty alcohol that gives consistency to cosmetic products. Very good emollient, it softens, smoothes and protects the skin. In hair products, it facilitates detangling while softening the hair. It is generally very suitable for dry skin. Cetyl alcohol can be produced from coconut oil. It is authorized for organicuse. 

The CIR (Cosmetic Ingredient Review) in an annual report published in 2008, concluded that fatty alcohols are safe.
detailed_info.reference: CIR Annual Review of Cosmetic Ingredient Safety Assessments: 2005/2006 - (2008) https://online.personalcarecouncil.org/ctfa-static/online/lists/cir-pdfs/prn547.PDF
